stream_context.summary: Kaze live-builds the Quest 13 ice-castle level: refining aesthetics (snowflake textures, lighting), laying out rooms, and solving a key design problem—how the player will shatter an ice wall to reach the first star.

development_findings.summary: Added several new platform mechanics (bridges, doors, appearing paths) since the previous stream and began placing them in the level.
development_findings.quote: So I made a lot of things happen since last stream – we got some platforming mechanics now.

development_findings.summary: Invented a seamless, repeating snowflake texture for platforms and walls.
development_findings.quote: I needed a seamless snowflake pattern that repeats… I invented this pattern.

development_findings.summary: Re-worked the ‘appearing path’ so tiles now grow gradually, giving a smoother visual effect.
development_findings.quote: You see how they now grow first and then they slowly grow into the whole thing – it's not as abrupt anymore.

development_findings.summary: Overall level concept: an open-ended frozen castle where the first sight is a star trapped behind an ice wall; multiple routes (slides, staircases, outside sections) eventually loop back to it.
Brainstormed several methods to break the ice wall (chandelier swing, cannon, vanish cap) and settled on rolling a large snowball from a snowman down a ramp to smash it.
development_findings.quote: Maybe a snowball on a platform like in Snowman's Land… you push the snowball and you follow it and land right on the star – I think we figured it out.

development_findings.summary: Planned decorative spiral staircases that double as slides; adds curved corners for castle realism and directs the camera toward the ice wall.
Boss fight will be the Giant Raven from Yoshi’s Island, fought on the castle roof with a moon-silhouette intro where the screen blacks out except for two glowing eyes.
development_findings.quote: Slowly from the bottom you see a shadow cover the moon… out of the pure black you see two eyes opening – that's the boss intro.

development_findings.summary: 8-bit pipe location unresolved; possibilities include a hidden outside entrance or a fake, non-solid interior wall.
Primary technical limits are anticipated memory usage rather than frame-rate; object models like chandeliers might be converted to dynamic objects to save space.
Toolchain: Blender + Fast64 exporter, Mario 64 decompilation, F3D microcode; repo for the hack is currently private.
development_findings.quote: The newest one is not public… maybe next time I release a mini hack I will make it public again.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is frustrated with Windows 10/11 updates introducing bugs and is seriously considering switching to Linux for development.
context_findings.quote: I think I might become a Linux user in the new year… the shit in Windows 11 just seems too bad.

context_findings.summary: Places gameplay above story or décor: theme comes after solid platforming; avoids puzzles that stall momentum.
context_findings.quote: The theming is gonna be after the platforming – the theming should be secondary to the gameplay.

context_findings.summary: Expresses dislike for trendy indie horror games and weed; encourages unique project ideas instead.
context_findings.quote: Not making an indie horror game. I don't like those.

context_findings.summary: Open about personal well-being: knee injury causing pain; ends stream early because of it.
context_findings.quote: The knee pain is getting pretty bad and I need to get up, so I will be seeing you guys some other time.

context_findings.summary: Sees the hack as future marketing: "This will be pretty insane advertisement for whenever I do my own game… marketing seems to be 90 percent of the equation."

biobak.summary: Supplied a low-poly penguin ice-statue model; Kaze noticed duplicate triangles and optimized it.
biobak.quote: Did Biobak sneak in a triangle… either way that's six triangles down.

zeina.summary: Provided real-time artistic feedback (texture balance, low-poly vs smooth models) while also present physically off-camera moving furniture.

key_stories.title: The Ice-Wall Star
key_stories.summary: Kaze wants players to spot a star trapped in ice immediately on entering the level but reach it only after exploring. Multiple solutions were tested until a satisfying mechanic emerged.
key_stories.challenge: Design a memorable, readable mystery: star is visible but unreachable.
key_stories.process: Considered swinging a chandelier (required complex math), cannons, vanish cap; ultimately pivoted to rolling a giant snowball from a nearby balcony.
key_stories.outcome: Snowball roll chosen; geometry adjusted to create space and camera angle; star will shatter free when struck.
key_stories.key_quote: You push the snowball and you follow it and land right on the star – I think we figured it out.

key_stories.title: Chandelier Pivot
key_stories.summary: A swinging chandelier was prototyped to double as traversal and puzzle element but was abandoned for complexity and player clarity.
key_stories.challenge: Needed a believable way to smash the ice wall.
key_stories.process: Designed a pendulum chandelier that the player could amplify; realized quaternion math and collision issues were excessive.
key_stories.outcome: Mechanic scrapped; chandelier may reappear only as a normal platform elsewhere.
key_stories.key_quote: The swinging just doesn't work at all… the chandelier idea is actually not good.

key_stories.title: Seamless Snowflake Breakthrough
key_stories.summary: Kaze developed a unique repeating snowflake texture that solves tiling seams and visually unifies the level.
key_stories.challenge: Needed a pattern that tiles perfectly yet looks organic.
key_stories.process: Drew a hexagon grid in Photoshop and iteratively painted snowflake arms to interlock.
key_stories.outcome: Pattern adopted for appearing paths and walls; chat response positive.
key_stories.key_quote: You can't tell me that this is not the coolest thing ever.

key_stories.title: Penguin Statue Contribution
key_stories.summary: Biobak supplies an ice penguin model that can double as a destructible Yoshi-coin objective.
key_stories.challenge: Need decorative objects that fit theme and are lightweight.
key_stories.process: Biobak models; Kaze optimizes geometry and tests shading; decides to use them as breakable statues for optional objectives.
key_stories.outcome: Statues accepted; will be tied to Yoshi-coin challenges (e.g., smash with snowball).
key_stories.key_quote: Smash an ice statue with a snowball – that should be one of the Yoshi coins.
